New Records: Buddy Hield has now made 23 3-points this season, breaking his own record for most made threes in the first five games with a new team in NBA history.
Key Match Events: Buddy Hield led the way with 21 points off the bench.
Brandin Podziemski finished with a near triple-double, recording 13 points, eight rebounds and seven assists.
Buddy Hield finished the game with a team-high 21 points, including a 26-foot buzzer beat to close the first half.
Draymond Green scored eight straight points for the Warriors in the second frame, knocking down two 3-pointers during his run.
Draymond Green finished with a season-high 14 points, connecting on three 3-pointers in the win. He also recorded five blocks on the night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors defeated the New Orleans Pelicans 104-89 at Chase Center.
The Warriors took the lead right out of the gate, scoring the first six points of the night and never looked back.
The Warriors scored 11 of the first 13 points of the second half to take a commanding double-digit lead.
Lindy Waters III got his first career start as a Warrior, and the second of his career.
